Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.06.30]RI of dev into master" (#8079) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.06.30]FI of master into dev - Gallery" (#8077) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "[Dependents] Investigate query performance issue" (#8078) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We shipped the package dependents feature to PROD but noticed high query times. After some conversations with the SQL Server team this is related to the query plan that is being selected via parameter sniffing.

We got into a situation in PROD where there are at least two wildly different query plans that appropriate for their different parameter values. For example, the query plan of sniffed from Newtonsoft.Json looks totally different from BaseTestPackage and the performance when the query plans get mixed up is unacceptable.

For example, using a BaseTestPackage parameter value for the Newtonsoft.Json query plan results in a query that takes longer than 30 seconds.

Some options:

1. Use `OPTION ( OPTIMIZE FOR UNKNOWN )` - this will cause very depended upon packages like Newtonsoft.Json to take 1-3 seconds per query. Maybe this okay with caching.
1. Use `OPTION ( RECOMPILE )` and allow every parameter value and query execution to evaluate its own query plan.
1. Investigate other options with the SQL Server team (perhaps there are new options coming out or we are missing something)

My vote is to try option 2 in PROD and verify DB and App Service resource utilization is nominal.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Published package with wrong name." (#8069) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
I have published the package TheToolBox.Data.Contracts v1.0.0 with the wrong name.
It should be TheToolbox.Data.Contracts (with lower case "b").

I contacted the support to remove the package but nothing happened.
I've tried to upload a new version (1.0.1) with the new name (after unlisting the old one) but it is still shown the old name.

Please help!!!!!

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2020.06.30]FI of master into dev - Gallery" (#8077) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Auxiliary2AzureSearch can fail if downloads.v1.json is being written" (#8076) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This is because it used `OpenReadAsync` to get a stream, which, in WindowsAzure.Storage, does sequential range requests with `If-Match`.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Deprecating TLS 1.0 and 1.1 on NuGet.org - Stage 2" (#7875) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
As announced in the blog post [here](https://devblogs.microsoft.com/nuget/deprecating-tls-1-0-and-1-1-on-nuget-org/), it's time to permanently remove support for TLS 1.0, 1.1.
Exact date in April is TBD and will be announced several weeks in advance.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Dependents] Add configurable cache time" (#8038) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Add 'Include verified packages' filter to Advanced Search" (#8075) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
We received customer feedback about adding an option to only return verified packages from reserved namespaces in the advanced search panel.

e.g, if a search for "WebAPI" is done, with that option enabled, only packages from Microsoft would be shown and not from other package authors.

This feature is related, yet not part of the #2636 Epic

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Invalid package in non-active TFM can cause packages subtree to be empty" (#9741) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
(Copied from https://github.com/dotnet/project-system/issues/6311)

**Visual Studio Version**: Version 16.7.0 Preview 4.0 [30228.12.master]

Works in 16.6.2.

- Have a multi-target project.
- Add a reference conditionally to the non-active (i.e. non-first) TFM
- Use an invalid version number for that reference

```xml
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk">

    <PropertyGroup>
        <TargetFrameworks>net48;net5</TargetFrameworks>
    </PropertyGroup>

    <ItemGroup Condition=" '$(TargetFramework)' == 'net5' ">
        <PackageReference Include="Newtonsoft.JSON" Version="100.100.100" />
    </ItemGroup>

</Project>
```

Result is that the "Packages" node shows a chevron to expand, yet no children are presented, which should never happen:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/350947/85969366-c5408280-ba0a-11ea-8e5e-f1466dbe45a3.png)

When expanding the "Packages" node, this exception is raised:

> Could not find project item with item type 'PackageReference' and include value 'Newtonsoft.JSON'.

<details>
<summary>Stack trace</summary>

```
 	PresentationCore.dll!System.Windows.Interop.HwndMouseInputProvider.FilterMessage(System.IntPtr hwnd, MS.Internal.Interop.WindowMessage msg, System.IntPtr wParam, System.IntPtr lParam, ref bool handled)	Unknown

 	WindowsBase.dll!MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(object o)	Unknown
 	WindowsBase.dll!System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(System.Delegate callback, object args, int numArgs)	Unknown

 	WindowsBase.dll!System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.LegacyInvokeImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority priority, System.TimeSpan timeout, System.Delegate method, object args, int numArgs)	Unknown
 	WindowsBase.dll!MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(System.IntPtr hwnd, int msg, System.IntPtr wParam, System.IntPtr lParam)	Unknown
```

</details>

The exception is being thrown when `NuGet.VisualStudio.SolutionExplorer.PackageReferenceAttachedCollectionSourceProvider` attempts to inspect the `Version` property of the `IVsHierarchyItem`'s browse object.

This results in the item not being displayed in the tree.

The problem here is that the DTE view of the project only includes the active TFM. Nodes for non-primary TFMs currently may not be present in the project instance.

We can make handle the exception gracefully which will allow the child to appear, however it will still not function correctly. For example, the diagnostic child item will not be displayed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Test Failure][Signing] ‘Value cannot be null’ error occurs when installing signed package with certificate is not trusted" (#9728) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

**NuGet Version:** NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6677
**VS Version:** Master\30226.129
**OS Version:** Windows-10-Enterprise-RS5

## Installation steps: 
1.  Install VS Master\30226.129 from: [https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_build/results?buildId=3846424&view=ms.vss-build-web.run-extensions-tab](url)
2.  Install NuGet Client: [\\\ddfiles\Drops\NuGet\Drops\CI\NuGet.Client\Dev\5.7.0.6677\artifacts\VS15\NuGet.Tools.vsix](url)

## Repro steps: 

1. Create a .NET Framework package for testing.
2. Create a new test certificate:  .\CreateTestCertificate.ps1.
3. Sign a package:  NuGet.exe sign <<PackageFilePath>PackageFilePath> -CertificatePath <<PackageFilePath>PfxFilePath>.
4. Open Package Manager UI, install the package with **package.config format** into a project.

## Expected:
There was no error and the package can be installed into the project.

## Actual:
‘Value cannot be null’ error occurs when installing package as below screenshot.
![bug0629](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632775/85994208-114eef80-ba2a-11ea-9631-bcc78ad0a014.png)

## Notes: 
1. The issue didn’t repro on .Net Core project.
2. The issue didn’t repro on Master\30223.54 + NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6670.
3. The issue didn’t repro on Master\30226.129 with implicit NuGet Client Dev\5.7.0.6665.
4. The issue also repro when using other certificate **except for** .\CreateTestCertificate.ps1 -AddAsTrustedRootAuthority.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[CPVM] Find a solution with better performance to reject the central transitive dependencies that have rejected parents. " (#9740) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
Related with the issue [Rejected transitive central dependencies should be removed from the restore graph](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/9483) 

The [current solution](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3374) does multiple loops through the the list of the central dependencies and their parents to detect any rejected parents. 

Evaluate if a different solution with better performance exists.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "CVE-2020-1340 - NuGet Gallery Spoofing Vulnerability" (#45) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
A spoofing vulnerability exists when the NuGet Gallery does not properly sanitize input on package metadata values. An attacker who successfully exploited the vulnerability could perform cross-site scripting attacks and run scripts in the security context of the user viewing the malicious content.

To exploit this vulnerability, an attacker with permissions to upload packages could publish specially crafted content on a gallery page.

The security update addresses the vulnerability by correcting how NuGet Gallery sanitizes input.

**MSRC Security Guidance:** [CVE-2020-1340](https://portal.msrc.microsoft.com/en-US/security-guidance/advisory/CVE-2020-1340)
**Security Update:** [v2020.06.09](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/releases/tag/v2020.06.09)
